Redaction Description: Direct identifiers: name; address; phone; email; ID numbers
Indirect identifiers: role plus small team context; unique events; rare attributes
Third-party spill: unrelated people caught in the record
Physical safety: threats; location risks
System security: credentials; network details; security controls
Operational security: routines; response playbooks
Supplied in confidence: externally provided information
Business or commercial confidence: procurement; pricing; negotiations
Inter-agency confidentiality: referral pathways; sharing constraints
Drafting and iteration: working drafts; tracked changes
Deliberation material: options; advice; internal debate
Legal material: advice; privilege claims; litigation posture
Ongoing investigations: integrity bodies; HR processes; audits
Law enforcement overlap: offences; intelligence; methods
Over-redaction: job titles and dates removed even where identity risk is already eliminated
Inconsistency: same fact redacted in one place but disclosed elsewhere
Mosaic risk without explanation: could identify an individual asserted with no description of what combination creates the risk
Category drift: privacy invoked to remove operational embarrassment e.g. redacting process errors that do not identify anyone
Blanket application: entire paragraphs blacked out where only one sentence contains sensitive detail
Entire recommendation paragraph
Notes: Blanket redaction: only one sentence arguably deliberative

Redaction Description: Senior policy officer title
Notes: Title alone does not identify individual in large agency

Redaction Description: Contractor pricing schedule
Name disclosed in footer
Notes: Same name redacted on p.1 but visible here
